title: Acceleration and time to land for 2 balls

content.question: Balls 1 and 2 are each thrown horizontally from the same height above level ground, but ball 2 has a greater initial velocity after leaving the throwerâ€™s hand. If air resistance is negligible, how do the accelerations of the balls and the times it takes them to hit the ground compare?

choices.label: Acceleration a Time to Hit Ground Greater for ball 2 Greater for ball 2
Acceleration a Time to Hit Ground Greater for ball 2 Equal
Acceleration a Time to Hit Ground Equal Greater for ball 2
Acceleration a Time to Hit Ground Equal Less for ball 2
Acceleration a Time to Hit Ground Equal Equal

content.answer: Acceleration a Time to Hit Ground Equal Equal

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
